Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk rpm
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: rpm bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The RPM Package Manager (RPM) is a command-line driven package management system capable of installing, uninstalling, verifying, querying, and updating software packages. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the brp-python-bytecompile script skipped paths that included the "/usr/lib.*/python.+/" pattern. Consequently, when creating an RPM package that contained Python modules in paths such as "/opt/myapp/usr/lib64/python2.6/site-packages/mypackage/", bytecode was not created. The reproducer specification has been changed, and bytecode is now created for all paths. (BZ#1083052) The RPM Package Manager (RPM) considers symbolic links to a directory equal to the directory in operations such as installation of a package. Previously, this rule was not used during verification, which led to verification errors on packages that were cleanly installed. This inconsistent behavior has been fixed with this update, and symbolic links to directories are now considered equal to directories for verification as well. (BZ#1101861) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: With this update, the RPM Package Manager has been updated to support Red Hat Enterprise Linux for POWER, little endian. (BZ#1124169) Users of rpm are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. All running applications linked against the RPM library must be restarted for this update to take effect. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
